SAMPLES.BODY:
21 - School - Government
25 - School - Catholic
27 - School - Independent
31 - Technical and Further Education institute
61 - Community-based adult education provider
91 - Privately operated registered training organisation
92 - Home school arrangement

SAMPLES.DESCRIPTION: Example response for a successful request

PARAMETERS.NAME: legalName
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The legal name of the organisation

PARAMETERS.NAME: orgOptionalID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: An optional identifier to use for this organisation record.

PARAMETERS.NAME: employerContactID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The Contact ID of the Employer

PARAMETERS.NAME: payerContactID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The Contact ID of the Payer

PARAMETERS.NAME: orgNameAccounting
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the organisation (for accounting / finance engine)

PARAMETERS.NAME: organisationNotes
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: Notes field stored against the organisation

PARAMETERS.NAME: purchaseOrderRequired
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: Is a purchase order required when invoicing this organisation?

PARAMETERS.NAME: schoolTypeID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: School Type Identifier AVETMISS field. See samples below for valid values.

PARAMETERS.NAME: categoryIDs
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: A list of valid Organisation Category IDs

PARAMETERS.NAME: keyContactIDs
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: A list of valid Contact IDs

PARAMETERS.NAME: customField_[variableName]
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: Replace [variableName] with the actual customField variable name to set a customField value against the Organisation. If updating a custom field that supports multiple values, you can use comma-delimited values or a JSON array. If using comma-delimited, it is expected the data is URL encoded first. For example, to get 2 values: 'A,B' and 'C' you would either pass: "['A,B','C']" or "A%2CB,C"
